name: Plow Pose (Halasana)
description: Lie on your back and lift your legs over your head, lowering your toes to the floor behind your head. Keep your legs straight and support your lower back with your hands, or extend arms along the floor for a deeper stretch. Your weight should be on your shoulders, not your neck. This pose stretches the entire posterior chain and calms the nervous system. Hold for 30-60 seconds. Contraindicated for those with neck injuries.
